decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly mill cards and put creatures into the graveyard, allowing for powerful combos to be set up. By utilizing cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Faithless Looting, the player can quickly fill their graveyard with creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine. Once these creatures are in the graveyard, they can be easily brought back to the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with a quick and aggressive playstyle. The deck also includes removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Lightning Axe to control the board and ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

This deck focuses on quickly casting cheap spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal fast damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Manamorphose and Faithless Looting to help dig through the deck and trigger the Phoenix's ability. Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage provide additional aggressive threats, while Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike offer direct damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and burn spells, aiming to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly and aggressively cast spells that can trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck contains a mix of cheap burn spells, cantrips, and creatures with prowess to efficiently trigger the Phoenix's ability multiple times in quick succession. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Light Up the Stage, the deck aims to maintain consistency and card advantage while continuously pressuring the opponent with hasty creatures and direct damage spells.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize graveyard synergy and self-mill cards to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, allowing for explosive plays with cards like Hogaak, Vengevine, and Gravecrawler. By leveraging cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, the deck aims to consistently generate value and create a powerful board presence quickly. The inclusion of Leyline of the Void helps to disrupt opponent graveyard strategies while also enabling the deck's own game plan. Overall, the deck excels at overwhelming opponents with a fast-paced combo-driven gameplay style.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to combo off using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana. With Chord of Calling, Finale of Devastation, and Eladamri's Call, the deck can tutor for specific creatures needed for the combo or for protection like Shalai, Voice of Plenty. Giver of Runes provides protection for key creatures, while Eternal Witness helps recur key cards. The deck also includes mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch for ramp. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Tron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast high-cost threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes removal and disruption in the form of cards like Oblivion Stone, Relic of Progenitus, and Walking Ballista to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to outvalue and out-maneuver the opponent with powerful threats and versatile removal spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards like Death's Shadow, Ranger-Captain of Eos, and Tidehollow Sculler to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Path to Exile while maintaining card advantage with Mishra's Bauble and Nihil Spellbomb. The inclusion of cards like Unearth and Temur Battle Rage allows for explosive plays and potential lethal damage output. It also has a mana base that supports the aggressive strategy while providing access to multiple colors for versatile spellcasting.

The deck focuses on using counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to control the game and limit the opponent's resources. It includes cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Snapcaster Mage allows for recursion of key spells, while cards like Force of Negation and Cryptic Command provide additional ways to interact with the opponent's spells. The deck aims to slow down the game, protect its threats, and eventually establish control to finish off the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to abuse graveyard interactions and creature recursion to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence. The deck focuses on filling the graveyard with cards like Hedron Crab, Stitcher's Supplier, and Faithless Looting to trigger abilities of creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine. Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis serves as a powerful threat that can be cast for free, while Altar of Dementia provides a win condition by milling the opponent out. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and close out the game before the opponent can respond.

The deck revolves around maximizing the number of +1/+1 counters placed on creatures by utilizing cards like Hardened Scales, Animation Module, and Arcbound Ravager. The strategy focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence with cards like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker while also having the ability to protect key pieces with Welding Jar and Throne of Geth. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently by using synergy between cards to create a powerful board state.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up your graveyard with Dredge creatures like Vengevine, Hogaak, and Gravecrawler. Using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Hedron Crab, you can quickly mill your deck and bring back multiple creatures from the graveyard each turn. Carrion Feeder and Cryptbreaker help you generate tokens and draw cards, keeping the engine going. With efficient removal like Fatal Push and consistent graveyard recursion, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a constant stream of creatures and win the game through sheer value and board presence.

This deck focuses on using Jeskai Ascendancy as a combo piece to generate mana and draw cards through a series of cantrips and mana dorks. By chaining spells together and untapping creatures with Fatestitcher, the deck aims to generate a large storm count to win the game in a single turn. Glittering Wish acts as a versatile toolbox card to find silver bullets from the sideboard. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and protection for the combo, allowing the player to protect their key pieces and disrupt their opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard interactions to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and trigger powerful combo plays, such as bringing back multiple creatures from the graveyard at once. Hedron Crab and Stitcher's Supplier help mill cards into the graveyard, while cards like Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine take advantage of being in the graveyard to gain value. Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis can be easily cast from the graveyard, and with the right setup, this deck can overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures. The key strategy is to utilize the graveyard as a resource to fuel explosive combos and overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive swarm of creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to use cards like Faithless Looting, Stitcher's Supplier, and Satyr Wayfinder to fill the graveyard quickly and bring back creatures like Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine. Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis is a key card that can be cast for free from the graveyard thanks to its delve ability. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing graveyard recursion and powerful creatures to achieve victory while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Leyline of the Void.

This control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using cards like Smallpox, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize to strip their hand of cards and resources. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Sorin, Solemn Visitor to generate value and control the board. Lingering Souls provides a steady stream of tokens for defense and offense, while cards like Fatal Push and Collective Brutality help deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish control over the game through resource denial and incremental advantage.
